plugins.name: BulkGen
plugins.description:
BulkGen figma plugin saves you hundreds of hours of doing grunt work. If you're tasked with creating the same design, lots of time with just some data changing â€” don't wast time doing it manually. Just use bulkgen, it can auto populate your figma designs from a Google Sheet.


Features:

  1. Google Sheet Import: Make sure these are set to public.
  2. CSV Import: Works for local files


How it Works:

  1. Paste your Google Sheets URL
  2. Make sure the dynamic layers in Figma are labelled correctly (ex: firstname would be #firstname)
  3. Select a base template and hit generate, it's that easy.


Use Cases:

  1. Event Banners: Doing the same event in many cities? This will work for that
  2. Certificates: Automate 1000s of certificates in just a few clicks
  3. Wedding Invites: Mail Merge is so oldschool, just use this.
  4. And Many More.


Website: https://bulkgen.app

Help docs: https://ybnco.notion.site/BulkGen-Help-Docs-1905dc1b35f980f0becbe647dfae68d4

Email me: yb@yashbhardwaj.com
plugins.tagline: Generate Figma Designs From Google Sheets/CSV

plugins.name: Grid Counter
plugins.description: Grid Counter calculates how many grid columns or rows a selected element spans within its parent frame. To use, simply select an element inside a frame with a layout grid, and the plugin will display the number of columns or rows it spans. It updates in real-time as you select different elements. You can also adjust the grid columns with a click of a button.

accepted.name: Jean Candelier
accepted.description: Front End Web Developer. Former Figma employee.

plugins.tagline: Instantly measure grid spans for any selected element.

plugins.name: EasyMemo
plugins.description:
EasyMemo is a versatile plugin for creating, editing, and managing text memos within Figma. With EasyMemo, you can easily add colorful sticky notes, shapes with text, and simple text nodes to your canvas, helping to keep your workspace organized.


Key Features:


Memo Creation and Editing: Simply enter your text, select your desired memo type, and create memos effortlessly. You can edit memos directly on the canvas, and updates are reflected in real-time.

Customizable Colors: Choose colors from a preset color palette, allowing you to categorize and prioritize memos. The text color automatically adjusts for optimal readability based on the selected background color.

Easy Management:


Organize Memos in a List: Add memos to a list for better organization. You can update or delete memo texts directly from the list. The list is scrollable and always up-to-date.

Batch Generation: Easily generate all listed memos at once. Just click the "Create Shapes" button, and all memos will be neatly arranged on the canvas.

Efficient Layout: Memos are generated in the center of the viewport, focusing on the most relevant areas. They are neatly arranged to avoid overlap.

User-Friendly Interface: The modern and intuitive design features a clearly laid-out text input area, radio buttons for selecting memo types, a color palette, and a dynamically updating list.

How to Use:


Enter Text: Input your memo content in the text input area.

Select Memo Type: Choose from shapes with text, simple text, or sticky notes using the radio buttons.

Pick a Color: Select a color from the palette to categorize your memos. The selected color applies to the memo background, and the text color adjusts automatically.

Add to List: Press the Enter key to add the memo to the list. You can edit or delete memos directly within the list.

Generate Memos: Click the "Create Shapes" button to generate all memos on the canvas at once. Memos are centered in the viewport and neatly arranged.

EasyMemo is the perfect tool for organizing ideas and feedback within your Figma projects. Whether brainstorming, planning, or collaborating, EasyMemo simplifies memo management and supports you efficiently.

plugins.name: ScreenHub
plugins.description:
Introducing the ScreenHub Figma plugin ğŸ§©


Easily way to access and import your collections directly into your design projects.


How it works:


1. Install the Screenhub plugin

2. Sign in or sign up to Screenhub

3. Organize your bookmarks into collections

4. Open the Screenhub plugin from any Figma file

5. Browse and preview your items

6. Click to insert items directly into your design


Questions / Ideas? Contact Us

plugins.name: strings_repository
plugins.description:
Simple plugin to synchronise translations with strings repository. Allows to push and pull translations from your own server. Works with active selection to speedup parsing processes.


Usage:

Enter connection details and press connect button.

After selection of element press "refresh selection" to get text labels from selection.

Press "pull" to fetch translations from remote server.

Press "apply" to apply translations from selected translations to document selection.

Press "push" to send translations to remote server.
plugins.tagline: Synchronize your translations

plugins.name: AutoFrame
plugins.description:
AutoFrame: Connect Airtable Data to Your Figma Designs


Bridge the gap between your data and your designs! Autoframe allows you to seamlessly connect your Airtable bases directly to Figma, automating the creation and synchronization of design elements.


Stop manually copying and pasting data. With Autoframe, you can generate perfectly structured Figma frames populated with real content from your Airtable views, saving you time and reducing errors.


Key Features:

  1. Secure Airtable Connection: Easily connect your Airtable account using a secure OAuth 2.0 flow.
  2. Automated Frame Generation: Select an Airtable Base, Table, and View, and instantly generate Figma frames for each record.
  3. Data-Driven Content: Choose specific Airtable fields to populate text layers within your frames, ensuring your designs reflect your actual data.
  4. Custom Frame Naming: Designate an Airtable field to automatically name your generated frames.
  5. Dynamic Frame Sizing: Optionally add a "Dimensions" field (e.g., 300x500) in your Airtable view to automatically set the width and height of corresponding Figma frames.
  6. Flexible Layout: Control the arrangement of generated frames by specifying the number of columns.
  7. Figma to Airtable: Push text edits or frame name changes made in Figma back to your Airtable base.
  8. Airtable to Figma: Pull the latest data from Airtable to update your existing generated frames without needing to regenerate everything.
  9. Secure Login: Protects access via an Email + One-Time Passcode (OTP) verification system.


How It Works:

  1. Connect: Log in and securely connect your Airtable account.
  2. Select: Choose your Airtable Base, Table, View, and the fields you want to use for frame names and content.
  3. Generate: Click "Generate Frames" to automatically create frames on your Figma canvas populated with your data.
  4. Sync: Use the "Sync Changes to Airtable" or "Sync From Airtable" buttons to keep your designs and data aligned.


Ideal For:

  1. Data-driven design workflows
  2. Managing dynamic content within designs (e.g., user profiles, product cards)
  3. Populating components for design systems
  4. Quickly visualizing data structures from Airtable
  5. Anyone looking to streamline their design process by integrating directly with Airtable.


Get started with AutoFrame today and bring your Airtable data to life in Figma!
plugins.tagline: Autoframe: The Bridge Between Airtable and Figma.

plugins.name: Condens
plugins.description:
With the Condens plugin, you can quickly import highlights from Condens into FigJam. This keeps your insights intact, preserving key details like participant names and links back to the original data.


Perfect for brainstorming, organizing ideas, and running synthesis workshops with your team â€” without losing the context behind your research, even when switching between tools.


How it works:

  1. Export your highlights from Condens as a CSV file.
  2. Open the Condens plugin in FigJam and upload the CSV file.
  3. Your Highlights are instantly converted into sticky notes, complete with the respondentâ€™s name and a direct link back to the original data in Condens, ready to use in your FigJam board.


Contact us for support, book a demo to get a personalized walkthrough, or visit our Help Center for more information.

If you're not using Condens yet, start your free 15-day trial at condens.io.

plugins.name: Silent Sweep
plugins.description:
Silent Sweep is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly managing concealed elements in your designs. This powerful tool scans your current page, revealing all hidden layers within each frame and artboard.

With its intuitive card-based interface, you can quickly identify and select hidden elements, streamlining your cleanup process.


Key Features:


  1. Instant Detection: Automatically finds all hidden layers on your current page.
  2. Organized View: Displays hidden layers grouped by their parent frames for easy navigation.
  3. Selective Cleanup: Choose which hidden layers to remove with simple checkboxes.
  4. Real-time Updates: Refreshes automatically when you switch pages or make changes.
  5. Efficient Workflow: Helps maintain clean, organized Figma files without tedious manual searching.


Whether you're polishing up a final design or inheriting a complex file, Silent Sweep helps you maintain a tidy workspace. Say goodbye to forgotten hidden layers and hello to cleaner, more manageable Figma projects. Simplify your design process and boost your productivity with Silent Sweep â€“ your personal cleanup assistant in Figma
plugins.tagline: Unveil and Tidy: Your Hidden Layer Ally

plugins.name: Tazym
plugins.description:
Introducing Tazym, the ultimate Figma plugin that streamlines the design-to-web process. With Tazym, you can effortlessly upload your designs to the cloud, generating a unique URL that allows you to update your design in Figma in real-time. Say goodbye to manual website updates or the need to rely on developers. With Tazym, you are the creator, and you own your designs.


Getting started with Tazym is easy. Simply select your design, name it, choose a format (SVG, PNG, or JPG), and voila - you have a URL that can be used anywhere to showcase your work. When inspiration strikes and you want to make updates, it's as easy as editing in Figma and hitting the Update button in Tazym. Your users will see your latest creations instantly.


Ready to take control of your designs and streamline your workflow? Visit tazym.com to learn more and start using Tazym today!

plugins.name: AdaptaFontâ€”Intelligent Font Scaling for Seamless Multi-Format Scenarios
plugins.description:
1. Text Font Size Adaptation for Different Image Dimension Requirements

Automatically adjusts text font size by modifying the fixed width and line count parameters according to different image dimension needs (e.g., designs for multiple e-commerce platforms), enabling rapid completion of typesetting in such scenarios.


2. Text Font Size Adaptation for Different Language Requirements

Through configuring font family, font weight, and line height settings, the plugin automatically adjusts font sizes for text content in various languages to adapt to the preset text width and line count, thereby quickly fulfilling typesetting requirements for globalized designs.


Features:


âŒ¨ï¸ Methods to Obtain Text:

Designers can acquire text content requiring adaptive font sizes either by selecting text nodes or inputting/pasting new text in the plugin's input field.


ğŸ”„ Reacquire Text Content & Text Properties:

Designers can click the refresh button to reacquire the text content, font, font weight, and line height of selected text layers on the canvas for further adjustments and optimization.


ğŸ‘€ Predict Actual Line Count:

The plugin features actual line count prediction capability, forecasting real line numbers based on current text content and settings to help designers better plan text layout.


â†™ï¸ Window Scaling:

The plugin window can be minimized by collapsing setting items, proving highly efficient in scenarios requiring rapid multi-language text replacement using identical text properties.


ğŸ¨ Theme Switching & Language Toggling

Switch between light/dark themes

Instant Chinese/English interface language switching

plugins.name: IconBridge â€“ Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that automates icon exports, optimizes assets, and pushes them directly to GitHubâ€”seamlessly integrating design and development. IconBridge eliminates manual file handling, ensuring every icon is correctly formatted, optimized, and instantly available for development.



âœ¨ Key Features


  1. Optimized Icon Export â€“ Export icons directly from Figma with automatic light/dark version generation for multi-colored icons.
  2. Seamless GitHub Integration â€“ Push icons directly from Figma to GitHub, with automated organization and validation.
  3. Automated Pull Request Creation â€“ IconBridge commits and opens a GitHub PR automatically, streamlining the handoff process.
  4. Secure Repository Access â€“ Uses GitHub authentication to ensure private and controlled icon handoff.




ğŸš€ How to Use


Quick & Optimized Icon Export

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click â€œExport Iconsâ€ on the home screen.
  3. IconBridge automatically optimizes each icon, ensuring clean, lightweight SVGs.
  4. Click â€œSaveâ€ to download optimized icons directly to your device.


Automated Handoff to GitHub

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click â€œExport to GitHubâ€ to begin the automation.
  3. IconBridge optimizes and validates each icon before uploading.
  4. Automatically organizes icons in the correct repository folder.
  5. Creates a pull request automatically, ready for developer review.




ğŸ› ï¸ What Youâ€™ll Need

  1. A Figma project with icons.
  2. A GitHub repository for automated exports.




ğŸ”’ Secure & Seamless Workflow

IconBridge ensures a secure, efficient, and automated handoff process:


  1. Direct Figma-to-GitHub integrationâ€”no external storage needed.
  2. Authentication with GitHub to keep your repository secure.
  3. Fully automated workflowâ€”eliminating manual exports, uploads, and PR creation.


ğŸš€ Forget tedious icon managementâ€”let IconBridge automate everything from Figma to production!
plugins.tagline: Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub

plugins.name: Codex â€” Repository-Aware Code Generator powered by AI
plugins.description:
Codex is an AI powered code generator that learns your existing repo. You can import your repository, and Codex will generate code in your used framework, using your styles and configurations. It works with any framework or language. No setup necessary â€” just import with one click and go!


Features


Code just like you wrote it yourself

Codex will adapt its code generation to the conventions and code style used across your repo. It will read config files and use the same libraries and frameworks you use in your project.


Refine your export further

Need to use a specific component? Instruct Codex to change your code and get a refined result, without losing the context. You can also do this multiple times, until youâ€™re 100% happy.


Learns your repository with a one-click-import

You donâ€™t have to map your figma components to your design system. Codex automatically recognizes which components you have implemented or installed and will use those for generating code.


Generates code in any framework or language

Any language, library or framework you are using in your repo will be used by Codex to generate code from Figma.


Learns from your feedback

As you refine your exports, Codex will remember your feedback and apply it to future code generations.


FAQ


Who is it for?

Codex is targeted at professional front end developers to speed up their workflows.


Does my figma file need special preparation?

No, but it works much better if all frames use auto layout.


Which frameworks are supported?

Codex is framework-agnostic. This means it can generate code in any language, for any framework. However, popular frameworks like React and Vue work best, as LLMs have more training data on them.


Can I use it without a repository?

Currently, no. But you can create a repository and initialize it with an empty skeleton in the framework of your choice, then Codex will generate code for that framework.


Does it work with monorepos?

If there is only one frontend package in the repo, likely yes. Better monorepo support is on the roadmap.


Does it only work in dev mode/design mode?

Codex works in both figma modes.


Does it only work with Github?

Currently, yes. Other providers coming soon.


Pricing


Check our pricing page for information on plans.
plugins.tagline: The code generator that understands your repository

plugins.name: MAPPE â€” Mini map for Figma
plugins.description:
The figma area (if we take the entire canvas) is 262,000 x 262,000 pixels. If there are few screens and they are small, you do not think about the actual canvas size. But when there are a lot of layouts, at some point you run into the edge of the canvas. At this point, you understand that it becomes impossible to navigate in figma.


MAPPE makes navigation in big files easier. The plugin shows where are you exactly on the canvas.

accepted.name: Roman Nebel
accepted.description: IT Manager / UX Expert / Pet-projects Developer

plugins.name: Background Color Generator
plugins.description:
Summary:

This plugin is ideal for B2B products where you want to integrate a clientâ€™s branding color into background designs while maintaining accessibility and strong visual contrast.


How to use:

Pick a color using the hue slider or a HEX code. Select the layer you want to apply the color to, then simply click the button to apply it. The plugin generates light and dark variations with the same hue.


Accessibility Compliance:

This plugin follows the WCAG 2.1 guidelines for color contrast:

  1. The light color is optimized for contrast against 87% black (#161616), and the dark color against white (#FFFFFF).
  2. For normal text (below 18pt bold / 24pt regular), the minimum contrast ratio is 4.5:1.
  3. For large text (18pt bold or 24pt regular and above), the minimum contrast ratio is 3:1.
  4. The generated light and dark color combinations exceed these minimum requirements, ensuring better readability and accessibility for users with visual impairments.


(Note: I made this plugin from Ai integrated in VS code. If you want to know more about what I do at work, you can check Daidai )
plugins.tagline: Color generator for light and dark backgrounds.

plugins.name: MagicText
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow by recognizing, transforming, and cleaning up text layers in seconds. Whether you're extracting text from images, converting case styles, or refining typography, this tool enhances productivity and ensures design consistency with just a few clicks.


How It Works:


1. Text Recognition

Use the built-in text recognize to quickly extract text from image layers. Simply select an image layer, choose the desired language, and launch text recognition â€“ the plugin will automatically create a new text layer with the extracted content.

Supported Languages: MagicText supports a wide range of languages: English, Chinese, Ukrainian, Spanish, German, French, Japanese, Korean, Arabic, Portuguese, Italian, Bulgarian, Greek, Hebrew, Hindi, Turkish and more.


2. Text Transformation:

Easily change the case of your text with a single click:

  1. Title Case: Capitalize the first letter of each word.
  2. Sentence Case: Capitalize only the first letter of each sentence.
  3. UPPERCASE & lowercase: Convert your text to all uppercase or all lowercase letters.


3. Text Manipulation:

Seamlessly merge multiple text layers into one or split a single text layer into individual sentences for easier editing.


4. Style Cleanup:

  1. Remove Hyperlinks: Automatically strip out hyperlinks from your text.
  2. Remove All Styles: Reset text and color styles, reverting your text to a clean, default appearance.


5. Character Counter:

Instantly see the number of characters, sentences, and words in your selected text layers for precise text management.


Key Features:

  1. Image-Based Text Recognition: Extract text from images with support for multiple languages.
  2. Case Conversion Options: Transform text to sentence case, title case, UPPERCASE, or lowercase in just a few clicks.
  3. Text Layer Manipulation: Merge and split text layers effortlessly to suit your workflow.
  4. Style Reset: Remove hyperlinks and reset text formatting to maintain consistency in your designs.
  5. Real-Time Character Counting: Keep track of characters, sentences, and words in real time.


Who Is It For?

MagicText is designed for Figma designers who want to streamline their text formatting and editing process. By automating repetitive tasks and offering powerful text transformation tools, MagicText allows you to focus more on creative design and less on manual text adjustments.


Feedback & Future Updates

Welcome your professional insights and suggestions for improvements. Your feedback is invaluable and will be carefully reviewed to guide future updates. Please share your ideas and help us enhance MagicText. Leave your feedback here.
plugins.tagline: Recognize, transform, and clean text layers instantlyâ€”enhancing productivity and consistency.

plugins.name: Class Action
plugins.description:
Class Action is a powerful CSS-like styling tool that revolutionizes how designers work with consistent design tokens and variables in Figma. Create Tailwind-inspired class libraries, UI kits, and design templates with ease, then apply saved styles instantly to other frames with a single click.


Key features:

  1. Create and manage reusable style classes similar to CSS and Tailwind classes
  2. Build and apply complete UI kits and design templates across multiple frames
  3. Preserve Figma variables, color tokens, and style references in your templates
  4. Full support for Tailwind-like utility classes, component styles, and design tokens
  5. Premium version with unlimited style classes and advanced template management


Class Action brings CSS and Tailwind-inspired workflows to Figma by eliminating repetitive styling tasks. Perfect for design systems, UI kit creation, template libraries, and maintaining visual consistency across projects. Save time, reduce styling errors, and keep your designs perfectly aligned with your component library or Tailwind-like system.


Compatible with both light and dark Figma themes, supports variable tokens for responsive templates, and optimized for performance even in large UI kit files with complex component libraries.
plugins.tagline: Think as a designer, act like a developer.

138910.release_notes:
This update delivers critical bug fixes and enhanced reliability that ensure seamless functionality when working with component frames and complex Figma elements. The plugin now provides robust error handling and comprehensive symbol protection to maintain consistent performance across all design scenarios.

New in this release:
â€¢ Component Frame Compatibility Fix: Resolved critical "Cannot unwrap symbol" error when creating classes from frames within components, enabling full functionality across all Figma element types
â€¢ Three-Layer Symbol Protection System: Comprehensive defense mechanism that automatically handles mixed properties and complex component states with intelligent fallback values
â€¢ Enhanced Debug System: Advanced diagnostic tools with detailed error analysis and actionable user guidance for troubleshooting component-related issues
â€¢ Improved Error Recovery: Robust error handling that gracefully manages symbol serialization issues without disrupting workflow continuity
â€¢ Universal Component Support: All vital functions (Update, Apply, Scope, Apply All, Apply Global) now work seamlessly with component frames and detached instances
â€¢ Enhanced Data Integrity: Safe serialization system that prevents crashes while preserving all essential design properties and relationships

These improvements ensure reliable performance when working with any Figma element type, addressing critical compatibility issues that could interrupt design workflows. The enhanced error handling and symbol protection provide a solid foundation for consistent plugin operation across complex design systems and component libraries.

plugins.name: Collect and Rename
plugins.description:
Collect and Rename allows users to easily collect text elements from a design document, rename them, and navigate to specific layers on different pages.


Main features:


1. Collection of text elements:

- The plugin automatically collects all text elements in the document.

2. Renaming texts:

- Ability to rename text layers directly in the plugin interface.

- After renaming, text layers are updated in real time.

3. Layer navigation:

- Ability to navigate to a specific layer, even if it is on a different page of the document.



How to use the plugin:


1. Installation and launch:

- Install the "Collect and Rename" plugin from the Figma Community.

- Open your project in Figma and launch the plugin through the "Plugins" menu.

2. Text collection:

- The plugin will automatically collect all text elements from the current document and display them in the interface.

3. Renaming texts:

- In the plugin interface, you will see a list of all text layers.

- For each text element:

- "Current text" shows the current text of the layer.

- "New text" provides a field for entering new text.

- Enter the new text in the "New text" field and press "Apply" or the Enter key to confirm.

- The layer text will be updated, and you will see a notification about a successful update.

4. Navigation to layers:

- Click on the text field of the layer to automatically navigate to it in the document, even if it is on a different page.

5. Closing the plugin:

- Close the plugin when you finish your work by pressing the "Close" button in the plugin interface.
plugins.tagline: The plugin shows all text layers in a list, making it easy to replace text.
